Description: Fragment of lower body of Attic pottery black-figured closed vase. Interior reserved. Exterior: part of chariot wheel (white on axle) and part of box, with ends of horses' tails (one in added red) beside the upper right hand spoke; to right, on far side of wheel, lower part of leg of striding female (the white paint worn).
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Antikenmuseum, Heidelberg. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Probably from same vase as J58b. Perhaps from a Gigantomachy scene, as on the Leagros group hydria, Vatican 422. Heidelberg, Antikenmuseum I52-I77 and I85-I92 have in the past been erroneously known and cited as J52-77 and J85-92.
Bibliographic references: CVA Heidelberg IV / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Deutschland Heidelberg, Universität (p.49 pl. 165.12)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0908)
